intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. jaervikylae, commonly known as the Jaervikylä hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Finland. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange composite flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native range.
